sources.full: Creature Club: Two Evolutions of the Carrion Crawler

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The dragon has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the dragon remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a chunk of rock, even while its Dim Lure is active.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight the dragon has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite or tail and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales acid in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 67 ({@damage 15d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Dim Lure
entries: The dragon can activate a bauble perched on its tail that emits dim light in a 60ft radius, which lasts until the beginning of the dragon's next turn. Creatures that start their turn within 30ft of this light and can see it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or use all their remaining movement for that turn to move closer to the light.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Flash (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon releases a blinding flash from its tail and spines. Each creature within 60 feet that can see the dragon must succeed a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition blinded} until the start of the dragons next turn.
{@i Created by Adam Buxton}

The Angler Dragon is one of the most fearsome creatures in the depths of the underdark, using its luminescent tail to lure prey to its lair where it ambushes them and feasts upon their flesh. It is less likely to reason or barter than other dragons; the influence of the underdark has driven them to a strange madness.

entries.name: Fallen Princes
entries: Believed to be a race of dragons condemned to live within the Underdark by Bahumut, these dragons were once the pinnacle of their kind. After refusing to take sides in the war between their metallic and chromatic kin they were forced underground. The topology and aberrant sway of the Underdark led these dragons to abandon their power of flight but gain tremendously powerful senses. This adaptation has also caused these once proud beasts to turn into wicked and malevolent creatures.

entries.name: Pitchblack Predators
entries: Using their superior climbing and tunneling abilities these dragons often create huge networks of burrows for hunting. They are predominantly ambush predators; using their rough camouflaged bodies they lay against the walls or ceiling of the cavern dangling their long tail down into the darkness and lighting the lure at the tip, placing it to resemble the safety of a campfire and wait for prey. They can wait for weeks at a time unmoving and patiently feeling, smelling and sensing its environment for any sign of food.
I'm shame to admit I almost fell for the lure myself. The flame I expected; I still can't explain the smell of marshmellows.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deva's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The deva can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: The deva's weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deva makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: The deva touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 ({@dice 4d8 + 2}) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

bonus.name: Mark of Retribution
entries: The deva marks a creature it can see with a divine brand of retribution. The brand lasts until the creature dies or the mark is removed. The mark can be removed with {@spell dispel magic}, in which case it is treated as a 5th level spell, or with {@spell dispel evil and good} by breaking the mark as if it were an enchantment.

bonus.name: Endless Pursuit
entries: The deva teleports within reach of a creature bearing a mark of retribution. This ability doesn't work if the creature is on a different plane of existence.

An angel is a celestial agent sent forth into the planes to further its god's agenda for weal or woe. Its sublime beauty and presence can drive awestruck onlookers to their knees. Yet angels are destroyers too, and their appearance portends doom as often as it signals hope.

entries.name: Shards of the Divine
entries: Angels are formed from the astral essence of benevolent gods and are thus divine beings of great power and foresight.

Angels act out the will of their gods with tireless devotion. Even chaotic good deities command lawful good angels, knowing that the angels' dedication to order best allows them to fulfill divine commands. An angel follows a single driving purpose, as decreed by its deity. However, an angel is incapable of following commands that stray from the path of law and good.

An angel slays evil creatures without remorse. As the embodiment of law and good, an angel is almost never mistaken in its judgments. This quality can create a sense of superiority in an angel, a sense that comes to the fore when an angel's task conflicts with the goals of another creature. The angel never acquiesces or gives way. When an angel is sent to aid mortals, it is sent not to serve but to command. The gods of good therefore send their angels among mortals only in response to the most dire circumstances.

entries.name: Fallen Angels
entries: An angel's moral compass grants it a sense of infallibility that can sometimes spell its undoing. Angels are usually too wise to fall for a simple deception, but sometimes pride can lead one to commit an evil act. Whether intentional or accidental, such an act is a permanent stain that marks the angel as an outcast. Fallen angels retain their power but lose their connection to the deities from which they were made. Most fallen angels take their banishment personally, rebelling against the powers they served by seeking rulership over a section of the Abyss or a place among other fallen in the hierarchy of the Nine Hells. Zariel, the ruler of the first layer of the Nine Hells, is such a creature. Rather than rebel, some fallen angels resign themselves to an isolated existence on the Material Plane, living in disguise as simple hermits. If they are redeemed, they can become powerful allies dedicated to justice and compassionate service.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: An angel doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Retributors
entries: Retributors are a cadre of angel set apart from their heavenly kin. While devas deliver hope to the faithful, retributor deva deliver ire and promises of retribution to heretics and blackguards.

trait.name: Devouring Brood
entries: The ankheg broodling deals an additional 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage to {@condition grappled} creatures.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h} 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Bloutzlout's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). The bloutzlout can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: Bloutzlout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) check and on saving thows against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and being knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: When one of bloutzlout's heads is sleeping, the other is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Bloutzlout makes two attacks, one with his battleaxe and one with his quarterstaff.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h} 14 ({@dice 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h} 14 ({@dice 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Eat Dis!
entries: Bloutzlout (the Zlout head) casts {@spell eldritch blast}.
{@i Created by Stephen Brady}

The Bloutzlout is a two-headed giant or ettin that has by fallen to a strange charm that grants it magical power. This power quickly goes to the bloutzlout's head, with the single head with the arcane potential quickly developing a keen desire to harness and study these new powers. This is often to the chagrin of the more straightforward other head who merely wishes to return to a simple life of squashing smaller folk and stealing sheep. For some reason; all giants afflicted by this charm adopt the name 'Bloutzlout'. This, at least, makes identifying the creatures easier.
Zlout insisted they lower their weapons when I explained my intent. I kept Blout ocupied for an hour with my week's rations, while Zlout offered several corrections to my {@s riting} writing.

monster.name: Dullahan
languages: understands Common but can't speak it.

trait.name: Delicate Circuitry
entries: While the dullahan is below half of its hit point maximum it gains vulnerablity to lightning damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the dullahan remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

trait.name: Heavy Tread
entries: The dullahan can't take the Dash action.

trait.name: Relentless Tracker
entries: The dullahan knows the distance and direction of the targets it has been sent to track at all times, as long as they are on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The dullahan deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Self-Repair
entries: The dullahan regains 1 hit point at the start of every round if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dullahan makes two attacks with their mace or shield.

action.name: Instant Darkness {@recharge}
entries: The dullahan casts {@spell darkness} targeting itself and requiring no components.

action.name: Paralyzing Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h} 9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed}. The target may repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h} 9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the Dullahan can immediately use a Shove action.

action.name: Shield Charge
entries: The dullahan moves up to 25 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any creature smaller than Huge. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, it makes a Shield Bash attack against that creature. If the attack hits, the target must also succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed ahead of the dullahan for the rest of this move. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is also knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Execute
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5ft., one {@condition prone} target. {@h} 30 ({@damage 3d12 + 10}) slashing damage. If a target is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack, they die.

action.name: Self-Destruct
entries: The dullahan explodes in a devastating arcane blast. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the Dullahan must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creaure takes (40) {@damage 8d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dullahan is reduced to 0 HP and is destroyed.

The dullahan can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dullahan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Shield Bash
entries: The dullahan makes one shield bash attack.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Mace (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dullahan makes one paralyzing mace attack.
{@i Created by Adam Bucerri}

The Dullahan is a headless construct, 12 feet tall and made of hard, cruel steel. Where a head should be is a metal hatch which leaks magical darkness in a liquid sheet. Its left hand is a glowing mace that can paralyze its foes, while its right arm features a huge bladed greatshield.

The Dullahan is intelligent enough to follow simple orders, but not enough to demonstrate creative problem-solving. The solution it normally employs is brute force - destroying anything between it and its target.

entries.name: The Perfect Assassin
entries: While the Dullahan is occasionally employed guard an important location, most often it is used to track down and kill a specific foe. To track an opponent, the Dullahan must be given a possession belonging to the creature or a piece of them; a bit of hair, a nail, or a drop of blood. Once attuned to the creature's life force, it will relentlessly hunt them down.

entries.name: Unstoppable Force
entries: The Dullahan can move faster then most creatures at short distances, but cannot effectively pursue fleeing prey. However the Dullahan is utterly relentless and will single-mindedly follow its target across incredible distances.

entries.name: Built to Kill
entries: Using its paralyzing mace and bladed shield to control the battlefield, it has deadly tools to get its prey into a vulnerable position. While it's regular attacks aren't too dangerous, it's coup de grace is fatal. If it can incapacitate it's enemies, it uses its bladed shield to instantly decapitate its victims.

entries.name: No Retreat
entries: The Dullahan will not stop its assault once engaged with its designated target. If the Dullahan realizes that it will be defeated without completing its mission, it will choose to self-destruct.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hatchling spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). The kirin hatchling can innately cast the following spells requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hatchling is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The kirin hatchling has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hatchling has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magic effects.

action.name: Hoof
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h} 2 ({@dice 1d4 + 2})

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h} 6 ({@dice 1d8 + 2})

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The kirin hatchling turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, casts a spell or until its concentration ends. Anything the kirin hatchling is carrying or wearing is {@condition invisible} as long as it remains in contact with the kirin hatchling.
{@i Created by Sam Gardner}

The majestic kirin is hatched from a egg made of feathers weaved from yellow light. Hatchlings mature physically by will of magic, rather than time, though their wisdom and insight is often the product of ages.
Adorable - horn still HURTS. Parents nearby?

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wakai's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries: The wakai gains a bonus to their AC equal to their Charisma (already included in the profile).

trait.name: Final Stand
entries: Once per day, when the wakai is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright it drops to 1 hit point instead. After activating this trait; the wakai is immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions and has advantage on all saving throws.

trait.name: Rapid Blade
entries: The wakai has mastered the art of the {@i Rapid Blade}, the fluid action of drawing a weapon from its sheath and striking a foe with a calculated series of attacks. If the wakai makes an attack roll with their longsword and draws it as of that attack they have advantage on the attack roll against one of their targets. The wakai can forgo the adavantage to make an additional attack against the same target. This ability can only be used once per turn.

trait.name: Wakai's Mask
entries: When the wakai casts {@spell hellish rebuke} the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Wakai's Mask for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wakai makes two melee attacks or makes two attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h} 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h} 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.
{@i Created by Stephen Brady}
{@i Throughout the Low Planes they wander, unmatched blademasters bound by honour.}

variant.name: Master of Flame and Shade
entries: Some fiend samurai master a fighting style incorporating their own {@spell shadow blade|XGE} alongside their longsword. These {@i Masters of Flame and Shade} gain the following additional trait.

entries.name: Two-blade Fighting Style
entries: If this creature makes a weapon attack with their longsword they can make an attack with a weapon with the light property as a bonus action.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the dream eater fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Preferred Prey
entries: The dream eater cannot sense any creature unless they are capable of casting a spell or carrying a magical item. On their turn the dream eater must move towards the nearest magic user it can sense.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dream eater makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and the target must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or gain a level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Terrorize {@recharge 5}
entries: The dream eater emits nightmarish visions. Each creature within 10 feet of the dream eater must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the dream eater's next turn. Also on a failed save the victim takes one level of Exhaustion.

legendary.name: Dream Walk
entries: The dream eater magically teleports up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Deep Slumber (Costs 2 Action)
entries: The dream eater targets one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 8 hours. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
{@i Created by Adam Buxton}

When a powerful magic user suffers a traumatic experience their dreams can turn dark and nightmarish. This foul energy leeches into the Shadowfell and as the nightmares grow more frequent, the power of the dreamer's magic consolidates into a Dream Eater. This foul aberration seeks sources of arcane power and negative emotion. If it can escape the Shadowfell, it begins to prey on magic users; lurking at the edges of their perception, sapping their mind and body of all energy and strength.

entries.name: Nightmarish Form
entries: The Dream Eater resembles a floating shadow with a contorted, tormented, screaming skull-like face atop a long sinewy neck. Their hanging arms end in three clawed fingers. Dangling below the main body are long whipping tendrils of shadow. Shadow drips from their body and a feeling of {@condition exhaustion} and dread emanates from them.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Alchemist's Fire (1d12/day)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}The target is covered in flaming adhesive and takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a {@dc 10} Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

action.name: Acid Vial (1d6/day)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage. When an oppenent is hit with the Acid Vial, randomly determine a single metal object carried by the target. It receives a single point of damage and takes a -1 penalty (to attack or AC as required). This modifier increase by 1 at the end of each of the targets turns. If the penalty reaches -3 the item is permanently destroyed. The acid can be removed safely with a successful DC 14 Intelligence (Alchemist's Tools) check or by wiping the item. If the check is failed or the acid wiped away the target receives a further ({@dice 1d6}) acid damage. If passed the acid is removed safely without further effect. The penalty modifiers remain on the item until it can repaired.
{@i Created by Adam Buxton}

While most goblins' curiousity begins and ends with the contents of their nose and ears, there are outliers that seek to better understand the strange and often frightening world around them. These goblins might scrape together the resources to become shamans, witches or alchemists. In any case, they retain the chaotic, destructive impulses of their kin and their experimentation has helped them develop new concoctions as strange and violent as the creature that brews them.
I was able to barter with them for a 'cough remedy'. I don't know what was in it, but it served as excellent fuel for my lamp.

variant.name: Boompowder Alchemist
entries: Some goblin alchemists have a knack for working with gunpowder, perhaps because of their ability to relate to its volatile and dangerous nature. These boompowder alchemists are able to develop powerful new destructive (and unstable) weapons. A boompowder alchemist has a goblin musket in their inventory and gains the following additional action.

entries.name: Boompowder Musket
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h} 8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) piercing damage. If the goblin alchemist rolls a natural 1 then the musket explodes, dealing 1d12 fire damage to each creature within 5 feet of the goblin alchemist.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, Holdro can deal an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Holdro fails a saving throw he can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Holdro makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks with his javelins.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h} 8 ({@dice 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage or 9 ({@dice 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5ft. or range 30/120ft., one target. {@h} 7 ({@dice 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Disarm
entries: If a melee attack roll made against Holdro results in a roll of 5 or lower (before modifiers), the attacker must make a {@dc 16} Strengh saving throw or be disarmed of the weapon they used to make the triggering attack. The weapon is pushed up to 5 feet away in a direction of Holdro's choice.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Holdro moves up to his speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

legendary.name: Weapon Attack
entries: Holdro makes a weapon attack.

legendary.name: Frighten Foe (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Holdro targets one enemy he can see within 30 feet. If the target can see or hear Holdro they must succeed a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of Holdro's next turn. A target that has already been {@condition frightened} or that has succeeded a save against this effect is immune from this ability for the next 24 hours.
{@i Created by Christopher Stewart of Black Crown Games}

Holdro the Red was once a hobgoblin general. Now through dark ritual he has entwined his body with draconic power and made pacts with Tiamat, the fell Queen of Dragons. His host; The Order of the Claw, is baptised anew in flame and dragonsblood. Now it marches under the banners of many of foul beasts and raiders. All are made part of the Claw, either by oath or subjugation.
The prisoner spoke at length about the Claw and its leader. If even half is true, this land must prepare for war.

trait.name: Light as Air (1/Day)
entries: The puffling can use a bonus action to become {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Shock
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) lightning damage.

action.name: Huff and Puff
entries: The puffling chooses a Large or smaller creature within 60 feet. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be pushed 30 feet and knocked {@condition prone}.
{@i Created by Kaybee}

entries.name: Chaotic Tricksters
entries: Pufflings are incorrigible tricksters. They spend their days floating around, blowing people out of windows and off rooftops. Watching harm come to other beings is their chiefest delight, however they do not seek to maximize the damage. As beings of Elemental Air, pufflings believe that order and stability are to be avoided at all costs. Anything stacked must be knocked over. Anything sorted must be rearranged.

entries.name: Provocateurs from the Plane of Air
entries: During wars on the Elemental Plane of Air, pufflings fly into battle, disrupting soldiers from both sides. They do not fight for glory or to affect the course of the battle in one way or another, but for the sheer joy of chaos.

entries.name: Helpful Familiar
entries: A puffling, given enough space to enact their chaotic desires can serve as a surprisingly helpful familiar to an attentive mage willing to expend the effort. Pufflings help reach books on high shelves and can be sent off to deliver messages, blowing a sealed envelope along a light zephyr to its destination. In much the same way that dog owners get used to walking their dog regularly, mages with pufflings find themselves often shredding old spellbooks, throwing the confetti into the air for their charge to blow around to expel their excitable energy.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The carrion moth has advantage on Wisdom (Peception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The carrion moth can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The carrion moth makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is {@condition paralyzed}. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h} 8 ({@dice 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hypnotic Wings
entries: The carrion moth's massive wings beat with a strange drone that stupefies its enemies. Each creature that can hear the drone within 30 feet of the carrion moth must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their next turn. Creatures who suffer this effect are immune to any carrion moth's Hypnotic Wings ability for the next 24 hours.
They can fly {@b and} somehow smell worse - avoid at reasonable cost.

entries.name: Corpulent Balloon
entries: The carrion moth is a bloated winged insect roughly the size of an ox. It has two massive wings which can bear it's round, hairy body aloft and grant it surprising agility. The moth feeds on the putrid corpses of its victims, which it captures in much the same way as its larval predecessor.

entries.name: Morbid Ascension
entries: A carrion crawler is said to turn into a moth when its eyes alight with a blood moon. If, in that same night it can bury itself in a graveyard or similar grim locale, it forms a cocoon. On the next full moon (blood or otherwise) the carrion moth emerges; fully grown and ravenous.

The biggest change to its behavior is a result of its wings; allowing it to nest in tree canopies, cliff faces and abandoned watchtowers. The nest of a carrion moth is invariably full of discarded items and little else other than a terrible stench, for the carrion moth eats most everything once it has rotted sufficiently.

entries.name: Behind the Screen
entries: {@i From the desk of Dan of Creature Club}

When designing the carrion moth, I wanted to swap the existing statistics instead of replacing the crawler. The moth just swaps Constitution and Dexterity. Attack values are based on Dexterity instead of Strength, improving its accuracy and damage. The change to Constitution also reduced the poison DC on the Tentacles attack. I also gave it 1 new ability, Hypnotic Wings. The attack mimics the crawler's paralysis poison but affects an area and only works once per creature. The attack save DC is based on the moth's Dexterity.

trait.name: Horn Toss
entries: When the carrion bettle pushes a Large or smaller creature it can force them to move in any direction, including upwards.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The carrion beetle has advantage on Wisdom (Peception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The carrion beetle can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The carrion beetle makes two attacks: one ram attack and one bite.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10ft., one creature. {@h} 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed a number of feet equal to the distance the carrion beetle has moved this turn (minimum 10 feet).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h} 8 ({@dice 2d4 + 3}) and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

Unlike the crawler or the moth, the carrion beetle is a ferocious armored insect that thrives in open conflict. The carrion beetle launches heedlessly into battle with foes of any size, tossing them above its head before bifurcating them with powerful jaws.

entries.name: Voracious Alphas
entries: Carrion beetles tend to seek out and form communities as the leader of a swarm of carrion crawlers. The beetle defends the crawlers from threats, taking the lion's share of the food in return.

entries.name: Bloodsoaked Champions
entries: A carrion crawler is said to evolve into a beetle if it witnesses a blood moon but cannot locate a place to bury its cocoon. Instead, it goes into a frenzy, seeking out and battling other berserk crawlers. The grubs that survive that night are hardened by dawn's light and over the course of a lunar month become adult carrion beetles.

legendaryGroup.name: Holdro the Red
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Holdro can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects; but can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: If Holdro is at less then half of his total HP, his breath attack recharges and he makes a breath attack.

If the ritual pool is intact, and an ally is within 5 feet of it, Holdro can command the ally to jump in. Holdro chants the command words for a ritual, and the creature in the pool gains the Red Half-Dragon Template.

Holdro shouts out, calling for reinforcements. One of the following enters his lair to assist him: 1 ogre, 2 bugbears, 2 red guard drakes, 4 hobgoblins without shields (AC 16), 4 worgs, 8 goblins. This action can only be used twice a day.

subclassFeature.name: Behir Soul
entries: The innate magic that dwells within you is drawn from the behir. This endowment might be the re-emergence of strength granted to an ancestor or the manifestation of a behir's own power in mortal form.

subclassFeature.name: Behir Ancestry
entries: At 1st level can speak, read, and write {@language Draconic}, you gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 90 feet, resistance to lightning damage and a climb speed equal to your walking speed.

subclassFeature.name: Electric Shuffle
entries: Additionally at 1st level, as a bonus action after you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning damage you may move up to half your speed without provoking attacks of opportunity. A friendly creature of your choice within reach may spend their reaction to gain the same benefit.

subclassFeature.name: Ride the Lightning
entries: Beginning at 6th level, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning damage you may spend 1 sorcery point to teleport to an unoccupied space adjacent to the target or the area affected by the spell. Whether or not you teleport you may also spend 1 sorcery point for each ally within 30 feet to allow them to spend their reaction to teleport in the same manner or spend 3 sorcery points to grant this benefit to each ally within 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Forked Tongue
entries: Additionally at 6th level your mastery of the draconic tongue allows you to hurl insults alongside your spells.

You may speak the name of a creature with the dragon type as an additional verbal component of a spell or ability granted by your bloodline that includes that creature as a target and requires a saving throw. If the creature can hear and understand you they have disadvantage on the saving throw. After failing a saving throw while being affected by this feature the creature is immune to this feature for the next 24 hours.
At your DM's discretion this ability could also affect appropriate creatures without the dragon type e.g: dracoliches or half-dragons.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Center
entries: Beginning at 14th level, as a bonus action you can summon the spirit of your behir ancestor chained in lightning and fury for the next minute.
Each creature of your choice within 10 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they are grappled and suffer 2d10 lightning damage. Otherwise they take half as much lightning damage.

Creatures grappled in this way remain so until your spirit is dismissed or they move more than 10 feet away from you. A creature grappled by this ability can use its action to make a {@skill Athletics|Strength (Athletics)} or {@skill Acrobatics|Dexterity (Acrobatics)} check (its choice) against your spell save DC ending the grapple on a success. Each grappled creature does not benefit from lightning resistance or immunity as long as they are grappled and suffers an additional 2d10 lightning damage at the start of each of their turns.

As long as your spirit is summoned at the start of each of your turns you can have one creature within 10 feet of you make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they are grappled and suffer 2d10 lightning damage. Otherwise they take half as much lightning damage.
As long as a creature is grappled by the spirit you can use your Electric Shuffle feature as if you had cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning damage.
For each creature grappled or restrained by your spirit your spells of 1st level or higher that deal lightning damage deal additional damage equal to your Charisma modifier per creature.
While you have your spirit summoned you may spend 1 sorcery point to generate one of the following effects as an action:

entries.name: Sparkmaster's Enmity
entries: Each creature in a 20 foot by 5 foot line must make a Dexterity saving throw. Each creature in that line suffers 12d10 lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. At the end of your turn your spirit is dismissed.

entries.name: Stormrider's Boon
entries: Each creature of your choice within 10 feet gains a 15 foot fly speed as long as your spirit is summoned. This speed increases by 5 feet for each creature grappled or restrained by this ability.

entries.name: Swallow
entries: Make a spell attack roll against one grappled enemy. If you hit that enemy is restrained. An enemy restrained by this ability suffers 2d10 lightning damage at the start of each of their turns. A creature restrained by this ability can use its action to make a {@skill Athletics|Strength (Athletics)} or {@skill Acrobatics|Dexterity (Acrobatics)} check (its choice) against your spell save DC ending the restrained condition on a success.
Your spirit is dismissed if you are incapacitated or you may dismiss it willingly as part of any other action.
You cannot use this feature again until after you have finished a long rest or unless you spend 4 sorcery points.

subclassFeature.name: Embody the Spark
entries: At 18th level you gain immunity to lightning damage.
Whenever a creature ignores or resists your lightning damage they suffer force damage equal to your Charisma modifier and lose their immunity or resistance to lightning for the next minute.

In addition, when you summon your spirit you may choose to join your form to the spirit as pure, incandescent energy. While in this form you have resistance to all damage except psychic damage and force damage and teleporting yourself via your Ride the Lightning feature does not cost any sorcery points.
